intro: Cladoseris, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are typically found in coastal areas and are adapted to saline and sandy soils. They are characterized by their striking, spiny leaves and showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in late summer. The genus includes several species, such as Cladoseris maritima, which is native to the Mediterranean region. Cladoseris plants are often used in ornamental gardening due to their unique appearance and ability to thrive in challenging environments.
